acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The papers were formally accessioned in 1974.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Frederic G. Mather (1844-1925) was an historian whose primary area of study was New York's role in the American Revolution, about which he wrote several books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Frederic G. Mather papers span the period 1910 to 1915 and consist of five items. Included are correspondence regarding Mather's writings as well as several disembodied pages from his book The Refugees of 1776 from Long Island to Connecticut, including the book's prospectus.
